title: Beyonce cancels Coachella performance on doctor's orders following pregnancy announcement
text:
Beyonce cancels Coachella performance on doctor's orders following pregnancy announcement The star revealed earlier this month she is expecting twins with husband Jay Z Share Comments By Alistair McGeorge 21:01, 23 FEB 2017 Celebs Beyonce at Coachella celebs Beyonce has pulled out of her upcoming performance at Coachella Valley Music & Arts Festival after being told by doctors to reduce her schedule during her pregnancy.
In a statement posted on the event's Facebook page, it was confirmed that she follow the advice and as such won't be headlining this year - but she will return for 2018.
"Following the advice of her doctors to keep a less rigorous schedule in the coming months, Beyonce has made the decision to forgo performing at the 2017 Coachella Valley Music & Arts Festival," the message read.
Beyonce has dropped out of her Coachella headline set (Photo: Facebook) "However, Goldenvoice and Parkwood are pleased to confirm that she will be a headliner at the 2018 festival. Thank you for your understanding."
Read More Pregnant Beyonce and Jay Z treat Blue Ivy to candy floss at NBA All Star game in New Orleans It comes just weeks after the star revealed she is expecting twins with her husband Jay Z.
There was hope she would be able to appear at Coachella after she performed live at the Grammys earlier this month.
Read More Pregnant Beyonce is FIERCE as she gives critics the finger at Solange's Grammy aftershow bash Introduced by her mother Tina Knowles, the superstar sang ballads Love Drought and Sandcastles.
Beyonce performed at the Grammys recently (Photo: Getty Images North America) Dressed in an ethereal gold gown and sparkling gold crown, the expectant star held her growing belly as she appeared on stage with her backing dancers.
As she finished, cameras panned to her husband Jay Z who was giving her a standing ovation and adorable daughter Blue who was also clapping her mum.
